intro: Fuirena ecklonii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring finely divided, feathery leaves. Its flowers are white to pale blue, appearing in clusters at the top of the stems. Fuirena ecklonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
